intro: Corydalis gyrophylla, commonly known as the yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to reddish-orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Corydalis gyrophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
